A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Absolutely wreaked of feminism. Producer Kathleen Kennedy destroyed this movie in the name of political correctness. 

Oh gee where do I start? How about for every male fighter pilot had to have a capable female counterpart pilot\, almost all the officers\, and generals were female. Almost all the leadership positions were made by females on the alliance side. The operators\, captains\, and even Rose the maintenance person. Fin gets put in his place and corrected by Rose and told she saved him instead of the other way around. Poe the Han Solo\, Mad Max male role model protagonist tries to hold the male plot of saving the alliance\, but is put in his place by Leah and her female general who knock him out and throw him in the brig. Because after all he's a hothead who can't think logically and rationally apparently a male trait (eyes roll). And let's not forget the most ridiculous part\, Fin hardly takes down the most bad a$$ storm trooper who is combat worthy\, military\, trained battled hardened in shiny silver armor\, but wait... is he a strong male with brute strength? Nope! He's a she. A female leading the storm troopers and apparently handing Fin's a$$ to him in battle because she has so much testosterone and physical strength apparently surpassing all the other elite storm troopers. Absolutely absurd. It was hard to even enjoy the movie when there was such an absorbent amount of energy put into culture appropriation and PC crap. I felt like I was watching the all female cast ghostbusters part 2\, crossed with Laura Croft and GI Jane.

Oh yes... I almost forgot Kathleen got to make sure the general of the alliance had her purple hair to appease the LGBT crowd. Of course! Thanks for turning this movie into one large anti-male\, feminist\, equality\, PC\, PR movement. You just lit up and pissed off 2/3 of your fanbase (yes males) on fire.
